title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Ramiro Magno. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

what: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
text: ruijter R data package provides real-time qPCR technical data sets used Ruijter et al. (2013) tidy format, namely: 94-replicates-4-dilutions data set: ds_94_4 380 replicates data set: ds_380 competimer data set: ds_competimer

title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
text: Install ruijter CRAN: can install development version ruijter like :

title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
code: library(ruijter) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2)  head(ds_94_4) #> # A tibble: 6 × 9 #>   well  replicate dye   target sample_type copies dilution cycle fluor #>   <fct> <fct>     <fct> <fct>  <fct>        <int>    <dbl> <int> <dbl> #> 1 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   ntc              0      Inf     1 5202. #> 2 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   ntc              0      Inf     2 5229. #> 3 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   ntc              0      Inf     3 5252. #> 4 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   ntc              0      Inf     4 5256. #> 5 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   ntc              0      Inf     5 5270. #> 6 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   ntc              0      Inf     6 5282.  dplyr::count(ds_94_4, well, replicate, sample_type, copies) #> # A tibble: 384 × 5 #>    well  replicate sample_type copies     n #>    <fct> <fct>     <fct>        <int> <int> #>  1 A1    1         ntc              0    45 #>  2 A2    2         ntc              0    45 #>  3 A3    1         std          15000    45 #>  4 A4    1         std            150    45 #>  5 A5    2         std          15000    45 #>  6 A6    2         std            150    45 #>  7 A7    3         std          15000    45 #>  8 A8    3         std            150    45 #>  9 A9    4         std          15000    45 #> 10 A10   4         std            150    45 #> # ℹ 374 more rows  ds_94_4 %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = well, col = as.character(copies))) +   geom_line(size = 0.1) +   labs(y = "Raw fluorescence", colour="Copy number", title = "Four-point 10-fold dilution series") +   guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 0.5))) #> Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. #> ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. #> This warning is displayed once every 8 hours. #> Call `lifecycle::last_lifecycle_warnings()` to see where this warning was #> generated.

what: Replicates for assessment of precision ds_380
title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
code: head(ds_380) #> # A tibble: 6 × 9 #>   well  replicate dye   target sample_type copies dilution cycle fluor #>   <fct> <fct>     <fct> <fct>  <fct>        <int>    <dbl> <int> <dbl> #> 1 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   std         150000        1     1 4340. #> 2 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   std         150000        1     2 4365. #> 3 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   std         150000        1     3 4381. #> 4 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   std         150000        1     4 4386. #> 5 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   std         150000        1     5 4398. #> 6 A1    1         SYBR  MYCN   std         150000        1     6 4400.  dplyr::count(ds_380, well, replicate, sample_type, copies) #> # A tibble: 384 × 5 #>    well  replicate sample_type copies     n #>    <fct> <fct>     <fct>        <int> <int> #>  1 A1    1         std         150000    45 #>  2 A2    2         std         150000    45 #>  3 A3    3         std         150000    45 #>  4 A4    4         std         150000    45 #>  5 A5    5         std         150000    45 #>  6 A6    6         std         150000    45 #>  7 A7    7         std         150000    45 #>  8 A8    8         std         150000    45 #>  9 A9    9         std         150000    45 #> 10 A10   10        std         150000    45 #> # ℹ 374 more rows  ds_380 %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = well, col = as.factor(copies))) +   geom_line(size = 0.1) +   labs(y = "Raw fluorescence", colour="Copy number", title = "380 replicates data set") +   guides(color = guide_legend(override.aes = list(size = 0.5)))

what: Competimer primers for PCR efficiency modulation ds_competimer
title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
code: head(ds_competimer) #> # A tibble: 6 × 10 #>   well  replicate dye     pct  conc target sample_type dilution cycle fluor #>   <fct> <fct>     <fct> <dbl> <dbl> <fct>  <fct>          <dbl> <int> <dbl> #> 1 <NA>  1         SYBR      0    64 AluSx  std                1     1  2.02 #> 2 <NA>  1         SYBR      0    64 AluSx  std                1     2  2.30 #> 3 <NA>  1         SYBR      0    64 AluSx  std                1     3  2.32 #> 4 <NA>  1         SYBR      0    64 AluSx  std                1     4  2.36 #> 5 <NA>  1         SYBR      0    64 AluSx  std                1     5  2.42 #> 6 <NA>  1         SYBR      0    64 AluSx  std                1     6  2.55  dplyr::count(ds_competimer, well, pct, conc, replicate, sample_type) #> # A tibble: 147 × 6 #>    well    pct   conc replicate sample_type     n #>    <fct> <dbl>  <dbl> <fct>     <fct>       <int> #>  1 <NA>      0 0      1         ntc            45 #>  2 <NA>      0 0      2         ntc            45 #>  3 <NA>      0 0      3         ntc            45 #>  4 <NA>      0 0.0625 1         std            45 #>  5 <NA>      0 0.0625 2         std            45 #>  6 <NA>      0 0.0625 3         std            45 #>  7 <NA>      0 0.25   1         std            45 #>  8 <NA>      0 0.25   2         std            45 #>  9 <NA>      0 0.25   3         std            45 #> 10 <NA>      0 1      1         std            45 #> # ℹ 137 more rows  ds_competimer %>%   ggplot(mapping = aes(x = cycle, y = fluor, group = interaction(pct, conc, replicate), col = interaction(pct, conc))) +   geom_line(size = 0.2) +   guides(color = "none") +   labs(y = "Raw fluorescence", title = "Competimer data set") +   facet_grid(rows = vars(pct), cols = vars(conc))

title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
text: use data provided please forget cite original work Ruijter et al. (2013), package.

title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
text: Please note ruijter project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013)
text: Jan M. Ruijter, Michael W. Pfaffl, Sheng Zhao, Andrej N. Spiess, Gregory Boggy, Jochen Blom,Robert G. Rutledge, Davide Sisti, Antoon Lievens, Katleen De Preter, Stefaan Derveaux, Jan Hellemans, Jo Vandesompele. Evaluation qPCR curve analysis methods reliable biomarker discovery: Bias, resolution, precision, implications. Methods 59 32–46 (2013). doi: 10.1016/j.ymeth.2012.08.011.

title: 380-replicates set — ds_380
text: 380-replicates set dilution consisting 150,000 molecules (see Admonition section ) MYCN oligonucleotide created 10 ng/µl yeast tRNA carrier. qPCR amplifications performed 380 replicated 8 µl reactions quadruplicated reactions NTC sample performed 384-well plate. qPCR done CFX 384 instrument (Bio-Rad). 384-well qPCR plate prepared using 96-well head pipetting robot (Tecan Freedom Evo 150). qPCR amplifications performed 8 µl containing: 4 µl iQ SYBR Green Supermix (Bio-Rad); 0.4 µl forward 0.4 µl reverse primer (5 µM ); 0.2 µl nuclease-free water; 3 µl standard oligonucleotide. reactions performed 384-well plates (Hard-Shell 384-well microplates Microseal B clear using adhesive seals (Bio-Rad). cycling conditions comprised 3 min polymerase activation 95 °C 45 cycles 15 s 95 °C 30 s 60 °C followed dissociation curve analysis 60 95 °C.

title: 380-replicates set — ds_380
text: concentration information curves data set seemingly incorrectly indicated original publication (confirmed email senior author Prof. Jo Vandesompele). Instead 15,000 copies reported original paper, number copies likely 150,000 copies (10x value indicated).

title: 380-replicates set — ds_380
text: data frame 17,280 rows 9 columns: well Well identifier. replicate Replicate identifier. dye reactions SYBR Green master mix (Roche) used, value always "SYBR". target Target identifier: MYCN. sample_type Sample type: "ntc" (template control) "std" (standard). copies Standard copy number: either 0 (NTCs), 150000 standards. dilution Dilution factor (reciprocal copies). Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: 380-replicates set — ds_380
text: https://medischebiologie.nl/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/qpcrdatamethods.zip

title: 94-replicates-4-dilutions set — ds_94_4
text: 94-replicates-4-dilutions set dilution series consisting four 10-fold serial dilution points, starting 15,000 molecules 15 molecules, created using 10 ng/µl yeast tRNA carrier (Roche). dilution carrier used create NTC sample. qPCR done CFX 384 instrument (Bio-Rad). 384-well qPCR plate prepared using 96-well head pipetting robot (Tecan Freedom Evo 150). qPCR amplifications performed 8 µl containing: 4 µl iQ SYBR Green Supermix (Bio-Rad); 0.4 µl forward 0.4 µl reverse primer (5 µM ); 0.2 µl nuclease-free water; 3 µl standard oligonucleotide. total 94 replicated reactions dispensed 4 dilution points. addition, NTC reaction analyzed 8 replicates. reactions performed 384-well plates (Hard-Shell 384-well microplates Microseal B clear using adhesive seals (Bio-Rad). cycling conditions comprised 3 min polymerase activation 95 °C 45 cycles 15 s 95 °C 30 s 60 °C followed dissociation curve analysis 60 95 °C.

title: 94-replicates-4-dilutions set — ds_94_4
text: concentration information curves data set seemingly incorrectly indicated (confirmed email senior author Prof. Jo Vandesompele). annotation provided supplementary material accompanies original publication reversed. , correct , annotation number copies ds_94_4 changed: 15 became 15,000 150 became 1,500 1,500 became 150 15,000 became 15

title: 94-replicates-4-dilutions set — ds_94_4
text: data frame 17,280 rows 9 columns: well Well identifier. replicate Replicate identifier. dye reactions SYBR Green master mix (Roche) used, value always "SYBR". target Target identifier: MYCN. sample_type Sample type: "ntc" (template control) "std" (standard). copies Standard copy number: either 0 (NTCs), 15, 150, 1500 15000 standards. dilution Dilution factor (reciprocal copies). Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: 94-replicates-4-dilutions set — ds_94_4
text: https://medischebiologie.nl/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/qpcrdatamethods.zip

title: Competimer set — ds_competimer
text: Competitive primers synthesized basis identical sequence blocked amination 3' end allow annealing, avoid elongation PCR process. six-point 4-fold serial dilution series made reference human genomic DNA (Roche), starting 64 ng/µl 0.0625 ng/µl, created 10 ng/µl yeast tRNA carrier. dilution carrier used create NTC sample. qPCR amplifications performed 7.5 µl total reaction volume containing: 3.75 µl 2x custom made qPCR SYBR green Mastermix (Eurogentec) 0.375 µl forward primer (5 µM) 0.375 µl reverse primer (5 µM) 1 µl mixture nuclease-free water equal amounts forward reverse competitive (aminated) primers 2 µl diluted standard total 7 competitive mixes prepared dilution point, containing 0%, 5%, 10%, 20%, 30%, 40%, 50% (total amount primer) competitive (aminated) forward reverse primers. reaction run triplicate. qPCR cycling performed LightCycler480 (Roche) using white LightCycler480 384-multiwell plates Light-Cycler480 sealing foils (Roche). cycling conditions com  prised 10 min polymerase activation 95 °C, 45 cycles 15 s 95 °C, 30 s 60 °C, followed dissociation curve analysis 60 95 °C.

title: Competimer set — ds_competimer
text: data frame 6,615 rows 10 columns: well Well identifier. replicate Replicate identifier. dye reactions SYBR Green master mix (Roche) used, value always "SYBR". pct Percentage competitive (aminated) primers mix. conc Concentration reference human genomic DNA (Roche): 64 ng/µl 0.0625 ng/µl. target Target identifier: AluSx. sample_type Sample type: "ntc" (template control) "std" (standard). dilution Dilution factor (reciprocal conc, .e. 64 / conc). Higher number means greater dilution. cycle PCR cycle. fluor Raw fluorescence values.

title: Competimer set — ds_competimer
text: https://medischebiologie.nl/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/qpcrdatamethods.zip

what: ruijter: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013) — ruijter-package
title: ruijter: Technical Data Sets by Ruijter et al. (2013) — ruijter-package
text: real-time quantitative polymerase chain reaction (qPCR) technical data sets Ruijter et al. (2013) doi:10.1016/j.ymeth.2012.08.011 : () four-point 10-fold dilution series; (ii) 380 replicates; (iii) competimer data set. three data sets can used benchmark qPCR methods. Original data set available https://medischebiologie.nl/wp-content/uploads/2019/02/qpcrdatamethods.zip. package fixes incorrect annotations original data sets.
